messages.subject: Re: Homeschool Blogs?
messages.msgSnippet: I had not been sure if I should post this, but I do have a blog. Not all homeschooling/unschooling all the time, but still its there.
messages.messageBody:
I had not been sure if I should post this, but I do have a blog.
Not all homeschooling/unschooling all the time, but still its there.
http://jwoolfolk.typepad.com/theothermother/
Be aware that its not totally child friendly if you have a problem
with foul language....
Julie W

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Re: Homeschool Blogs?
messages.msgSnippet: I love to write, but I am curious to know what exactly a blogger is, and how does one become a blogger? cslkll  wrote: Really? That sounds
messages.messageBody:
I love to write, but I am curious to know what exactly a blogger is, and how does one become a blogger?

cslkll <cslkll@...> wrote:
Really? That sounds wonderful :0)
you've peaked my interest! I just
don't know if I am the conference type...sigh...
I might have to consider it though :0)
krista

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Homeschool Blogs?
messages.msgSnippet: On Sun, 06 Mar 2005 10:43:32 -0500 Danielle Conger ... Yeah, I blog about everything... I lack focus! There s a blogring for unschoolers on xanga though, here:
messages.messageBody:
On Sun, 06 Mar 2005 10:43:32 -0500 Danielle Conger
<danielle.conger@...> writes:
>
> Doesn't Dar have a blog? If I recall, it's
> not
> exclusively about Unschooling, but she does discuss it.

Yeah, I blog about everything... I lack focus!

There's a blogring for unschoolers on xanga though, here:
http://www.xanga.com/groups/group.aspx?id=434691
There are twenty members right now, so twenty blogs written by
unschoolers who talk about it to some degree..

Dar

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
freeform@...
http://www.xanga.com/home.aspx?user=freeformlife
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Homeschool Blogs?
messages.msgSnippet: == ...  This is Danielle s blog and it is great! == Thanks Pam!  Maria, I ve added your blog to the list we keep over at
messages.messageBody:
==

>Anyone have any recommendations of good homeschool blogs to read?
>
>

<http://organiclearning.blogspot.com/>

This is Danielle's blog and it is great!

==

Thanks Pam! Maria, I've added your blog to the list we keep over at
AlwaysUnschooled. Jessie tried keeping one for a while, but it seems
she's stopped--bummer. Doesn't Dar have a blog? If I recall, it's not
exclusively about Unschooling, but she does discuss it.

For those who are interested, it looks as if I'll be doing a funshop at
this year's Live and Learn Conference about Web-based documentation,
covering blogs and websites. Maybe by next year, we'll have some more
Unschooling bloggers out there!

~~Danielle
Emily (7), Julia (6), Sam (4.5)
http://www.danielleconger.com/Homeschool/Welcomehome.html

~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*

"With our thoughts, we make the world." ~~Buddha

>
>
